Text: President Biden signed into law legislation to protect the thousands of individuals in the Marianas who depend on Medicaid for their health care insurance. H.R. 6617, a continuing funding resolution, extends the 17% local match rate for Marianas Medicaid through March 11. https://t.co/xv7mw4teCu

Last week, I had the opportunity to sit down & hear from Tinian constituents. Of particular concern: CDBG-DR loans. Mr. John Attao, Tinian Mayor Aldan‚Äôs new VA rep, also came by to inform me of his new role & to identify ways we can work together to help Tinian vets. https://t.co/xjcBmZg7Ar

We have been receiving emails & calls about Marianas residents' access to the tests due to issues on the website regarding post office boxes. These are issues affecting more than just us, nationwide.

We will have new guidance to report to you from .@HHSGov shortly.

The Biden admin. announced that a half-billion tests will be available free for American households to order online for home delivery, & the Marianas is included.

Order rapid COVID-19 home test kits at https://t.co/O0pGFBKkOF. https://t.co/FDsovdfN9g
Thank you for the birthday greetings, .@LeaderHoyer! https://t.co/HdUFhZExSD

Journalist Brennan P√ºrtzer stopped by the congressional office to interview me for his video series, ‚ÄúYour Blue Continent.‚Äù Mr. P√ºrtzer is on island working on mini documentaries telling stories of sustainable development & environmental progress led by the people of the Marianas https://t.co/ORVUg1AW3W

Marianas state & local-level gov'ts are receiving $492 million according to the Final Rule on use of the Coronavirus State & Local Fiscal Recovery Funds that Congress included in the American Rescue Plan.

Read more:
https://t.co/qxLdR80e3a https://t.co/HIHyFq5n32

November:

The Director of the Smithsonian American History Museum agreed to my request that the NMI flag & the flags of Am. Samoa, Guam & the US Virgin Islands be added to the display of flags surrounding the Museum. They raise the new insular area flags June 14, 2022, Flag Day. https://t.co/QMYGdzXjDS

October:

Because of the $30m we included in the Rescue Plan for Marianas food aid, about 2K more families became eligible for the Commonwealth‚Äôs Nutritional Assistance Program & benefits increased 23%. This is higher than in the contiguous 48 states, DC & the US Virgin Islands. https://t.co/xaq5ZfJzzK

September:

Based on legislation we passed in 2019, the Biden HHS Dept., has decided that federal Medicaid funding for the Marianas will be $64m in FY22. Under the previous administration funding was expected to drop to about $6 million. https://t.co/j056yrYMbi

August:

The NMI‚Äôs plan for distributing the increased child tax credit included in the Rescue Plan was passed. The Rescue Plan increased the credit to $3,600 per child under age 6 & $3K for ages 6-17. By November Marianas families had received $28,726,000. https://t.co/opyBWUd3lG

July:

As the House readied the FY22 spending bills, I successfully added language to the Homeland Security appropriation to forgive the $93,734,930 the Commonwealth borrowed from the federal government through the Community Disaster Loan program this year. https://t.co/8p1LD16uRX

June: 

I intro'd legislation creating a VA Advisory Committee for the US Outlying Areas & FAS. Composed of vets from the 5 territories, the FSM, RMI, & Palau, the committee would advise the Vets Secretary on how to improve benefits & services for vets in the insular areas. https://t.co/sBeSpwPUyR

May:

My request for insular area Medicaid improvement to be part of Pres. Biden‚Äôs 1st budget was successful. The Pres.‚Äô FY22 budget proposed eliminating Medicaid funding caps for the territories & aligning the matching rate with the States. https://t.co/KFgTIA8KRI

April:

On Earth Day, I reintro'd the Shark Fin Sales Elimination Act, H.R. 2811, which bans the possession and sale of shark fins in the US. A majority of House members, 237, from both sides of the aisle signed on as cosponsors. https://t.co/I4gDzAm9YU

March:

Democrats (with no GOP votes) passed the American Rescue Plan Act, providing economic relief to the people of the Marianas and Americans everywhere.

Read a breakdown of the $ the Marianas received:
https://t.co/eu4VvNUDnR https://t.co/Xaz0ma67JA

February:
At my urging, the new Biden admin. reversed a harmful Trump interpretation of a section of the CARES Act. As a result, those with reduced work hours or were furloughed, while their employer stayed open, became eligible for PUA and FPUC retroactively. https://t.co/UKRJgEJuta

January: 
- .@cnmi_pss was awarded $74.4m & 
- .@GoProa  $3.3m from the COVID relief measure Congress passed
- Intro'd H.R. 265, The Insular Area Medicaid Parity Act & got 74 cosponsors to agree to end Medicaid funding caps for the insular areas https://t.co/16U7LdT6Z7

The year 2021 was one of our most successful ever, as you will see in the month-by-month rundown of our work for you in DC, which we will post over the next few days.

Thank you for your continued trust in serving as your Member in Congress. https://t.co/V80950qwkQ
Constituents on Rota shared their stories with me during a visit last Wednesday. Of particular concern: access to care for vets. Thank you, gentlemen, for stopping by. https://t.co/ogoV28WKbi

A year ago today, I was evacuated from my apartment building when a bomb was found in a neighboring building. Luckily, I had just left the Capitol campus before it was breached.

.@kuamnews spoke with me about my experience.
#TBT #January6th
